screen_desc: The screenshot shows a settings screen for the Picture-in-picture feature of the Google Play Movies & TV app. It allows users to enable or disable the feature that lets the app continue playing in a small window if the user switches to another app. The current setting is enabled, indicated by the blue toggle.
action_think: The current action is to turn off the Picture-in-picture feature. The toggle switch is currently on, indicating that Picture-in-picture is enabled. The next step should be to click on the toggle switch to turn off Picture-in-picture.
action_plan: click on the toggle switch to turn off Picture-in-picture
action_desc: click on the toggle switch for 'Allow picture-in-picture' located at the right and upper part of the screen.
action_result: The toggle switch for "Allow picture-in-picture" has been turned off, which means the feature is now disabled. This aligns with the user's request to turn off picture-in-picture.
prev_action_result: The last action was to click on the "Google Play Movies & TV" settings, which allowed me to access its specific picture-in-picture settings. In the current screenshot, I have turned off the picture-in-picture feature for this app. This action has completed the user request because it disables this feature, as required by the user.
